text: The Mercedes-Benz S-Class is a series of full-size luxury cars and coupes produced by Mercedes-Benz since 1972. It has been known for incorporating various advanced technologies and safety features and serves as the flagship model of the Mercedes-Benz lineup. == First generation (W116;1972) == The W116 series was produced from 1972 to 1980 and is the first official S-Class model. It introduced features such as anti-lock braking system (ABS) and many safety features compared to its predecessors. == Second Generation (W126/C126;1979) == The W126, produced from 1979 to 1992, included things such as airbags, many engine options and electronic systems. It was recognized for its reliability and durability and is often regarded as a benchmark in luxury automotive engineering. == Third Generation (W140; 1991) == The W140, manufactured from 1991 to 1998, introduced dual airbags, traction control, and the electronic stability program (ESP). It was also the first S-Class to feature automatic climate control and a more extensive range of engine options. == Fourth generation (W220; 1998) == Produced from 1998 to 2005, the W220 series had a more modern design. It featured new features such as air suspension for and stability control. This generation also introduced new V8 and V12 engine options. == Fifth Generation(W221;2005) == The W221, made from 2005 to 2013, was known for its updated interior design, new technological features, and fuel efficiency. It included options like lane-keeping assist and night vision systems. == Sixth generation (W222/C217/A217; 2013) == The W222 series, produced from 2013 to 2020 had advanced technology. It offered features such as adaptive cruise control, a 360-degree camera, and a wider range of powertrain options, including hybrid engines. == Seventh Generation (W223;2020) == The W223 series, launched in 2020, is the current gen of the S-Class line. It includes modern driver assistance systems such as active lane-keeping, automatic parking, and a new MBUX infotainment system. The generation also offers hybrid options. == References == Category:Mercedes-Benz automobiles Category:Sedans Category:1970s automobiles Category:1980s automobiles Category:1990s automobiles Category:2000s automobiles Category:2010s automobiles Category:2020s automobiles
title: Mercedes-Benz S-Class
